message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: 
```java
String input = "16.82080560, 96.13055810";
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(input, ",");
String one = st.nextToken().trim();
String two = st.nextToken().trim();
```
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer class in Java is used to break a string into tokens. In this case, we are using the comma as the delimiter to split the string into two parts. The `nextToken()` method is used to get the next token from the string. The `trim()` method is used to remove any leading or trailing spaces from the tokens. So, after executing this code, `one` will contain "16.82080560" and `two` will contain "96.13055810".
